availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Mathew Fleming (Louisville, Kentucky, policeman and finisher in iron)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, policeman and finisher in iron. Kentucky native. Married to Elton Grant in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on June 28, 1831. Father of William E. Fleming, George L. Fleming, John Fleming, and Mary Fleming. Policeman in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1850. Finisher in iron in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 7, p. 375B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 7, p. 415.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 9, p. 186B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000482706.
"Mathew Fleming (1807-1874)," Find A Grave, Memorial 135622181, accessed November 26, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/135622181.
